availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: New York, farmer. Swanzey, New Hampshire, native. Married to Betsey Abbott in Stockbridge, Vermont, on January 1, 1810. Father of Daniel Abbott Fairbank, Eliza Fairbank Wakefield, Julia Fairbank Baxter, Calvin Fairbank, Danforth Abbott Fairbank, Almond Fairbank, Jane Ayers Fairbank Wilbur, Polly Abbott Fairbank Reed, Harriet Blossom Fairbank, and Lydia Hatch Fairbank Davie. Served in the War of 1812 from 1812 to 1814. Farmer in Wyoming County, New York, in 1815. Petitioned the governor for the release of his son, abolitionist Calvin Fairbank, in Kentucky in 1849. Died from cholera in Kentucky on July 7, 1849.

ab.bibl:
Lorenzo Sayles Fairbanks, Geneaology of the Fairbanks Family in America, 1633-1897 (Boston: American Printing and Engraving Company, 1897), p. 241-3.
